agency_description: The Commission on Administrative Justice Complaints Management Information System (CMIS) is a digital platform designed to streamline and enhance efficiency in the reporting and management of public complaints on maladministration.

The Government Press is a Department under the Executive Office of the President as per the Executive Order No. 1 of 2023. It is Kenya's major centralized facility for creating, verifying, distributing, and archiving official Government information. It is a long-standing printing establishment, responsible for printing and publishing official Government documents like laws of Kenya, the Kenya Gazette and its subsidiary legislations, government accountable documents for revenue collection
Promote The Production Of Kenya’s Essential Agricultural Inputs
To provide sustainable financing through participative and collaborative financial and non-financial interventions, innovations, technology and products

The Agricultural Information Resource Centre (AIRC), established in 1966 under the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development, provides agricultural information services, capacity building, and knowledge-sharing platforms for farmers and stakeholders. It documents, produces, and disseminates technical content, collaborates with agencies on value chains and TIMPS, and offers training in ICT and knowledge management. AIRC also hosts the Ministry's main library and uses various media, including radio, to share success stories and promote agricultural innovations.
To sustainably develop and promote scheduled crops value chains through effective regulation for economic growth

To Manufacture Yeast for Baking confectionary, Food Grade Extra Neutral Alcohol for Alcohol Beverages, Rectified and Denatured Spirits, Bottling and Packaging of Spirit and Manufacture of Carbon Dioxide
To provide Agricultural Training through the integration of Research and Extension
Chemelil Sugar Company Limited is mandated to Manufacture sugar and co-products from sugarcane and Establish and manage sugarcane plantations and assist others to do so.

Commodities Fund is a Kenyan Government agency, established by Crops Act 2013 under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries & Cooperatives to provide sustainable and affordable credit and advances for farm improvement; farm inputs; farming operations; agricultural Infrastructure development, equipment and to support processing initiatives.

The institute draws her mandate from Executive Order No. 1 of 2023 and the 4th schedule of Kenyan Constitution under the State Department for Livestock Development that include capacity building and technical assistance to counties. The mission of the institute is to provide quality training, research, consultancy and outreach services in dairy production

agency_name: Kenya Agriculture and Livestock Research Organisation (KALRO)
agency_description: Promote, streamline, coordinate, and regulate research in crops, livestock, genetic resources, and biotechnology and Expedite equitable access to research information, resources, technology and promote the application of the research findings and technology in the field of agriculture.

Kenya Plant Health Inspectorate Service (KEPHIS) is the government parastatal whose responsibility is to assure the quality of agricultural inputs and produce to prevent adverse impacts on the economy, the environment, and human health.

Kenya School of Agriculture is a tertiary agricultural training institution under the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development. Established in 2011, it succeeded Embu Agricultural Staff Training (EAST) College through a Gazette Notice Number 65 on June 17, 2011. The school is currently located at Wambugu Farm in Nyeri County.
To avail sufficient certified seeds competitively through research and development to the satisfaction of stakeholders

The National Biosafety Authority (NBA) was established by the Biosafety Act No. 2 of 2009 to exercise general supervision and control over the transfer, handling and use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs). GMOs are products of Modern Biotechnology that involve the manipulation of the genetic material of organisms through genetic engineering procedures.

National Cereals and Produce Board (NCPB) is a commercial State Corporation under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries and Cooperatives. The Board’s mandate is to provide logistics support services to the government on food security matters and to carry out market intervention for grains and farm inputs on behalf of the government.
National Cereals and Produce Board: To promote food production, trade in agricultural products and provide premier warehousing.
The Corporation promotes forest conservation by providing buffer zones of tea and assorted tree species to check human encroachment into the forestland
Our mandate is to manufacture sugar and co-products from sugarcane and establish and manage sugarcane plantations

To provide effective and scientific evidence-based regulatory service and facilitate trade in pest control products in the manufacture, distribution, sale, use and disposal to ensure safety of humans, animals and the environment for a healthy and wealthy nation

The Pyrethrum Industry in Kenya was regulated by the Pyrethrum Amendment Ordinance of 1938, which created the Pyrethrum Board of Kenya (PBK) which merged with the Pyrethrum Marketing Board to form one body. In partnership with Mitchell Cotts and the Commonwealth Development Corporation, PBK established the Pyrethrum Processing Company of Kenya in 1963.
Sony Sugar provides a range of services tailored to support our diverse clients including farmers, suppliers and contractors on this platform

The State Department of Agriculture, often a pivotal agency in each state's government, oversees policies and programs related to agriculture, farming, and rural development. Its primary role includes promoting agricultural productivity, ensuring food safety, supporting rural communities, and managing natural resources. Additionally, it may administer regulations, provide assistance to farmers, conduct research, and facilitate international trade related to agriculture.
Access Tea Board of Kenya's online services for regulation, coordination, and promotion of tea industry development.

To safeguard animal and human health, improve animal welfare, increase animal resource productivity and ensure safe and high quality animals and their products to facilitate food security and domestic and international trade

The Centre has the mandate to produce, preserve, and conserve animal genetic materials (semen embryos, tissues, and live animals) and rear breeding sires for the provision of high-quality disease-free semen to meet the national demand and for export.

Kenya Dairy Board is a state corporation under the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development established through an Act of Parliament, CAP 336 of the Laws of Kenya. The mandate of the Board is to provide for the improvement and control of the dairy industry and its products. The Board ensures safety and quality of dairy products through issuance of regulatory permits and inspection of Dairy Business premises.

Kenya Leather Development Council (KLDC) is a State Corporation established by the Government of Kenya under the Kenya Leather Development Council Order, 2011 (Legal Notice No. 114 of 9th September, 2011), under the State Corporations Act (Cap.446), Laws of Kenya. The Council was instituted as a Specialized agency to drive the Government’s agenda on the development leather industry. To achieve this, the Council is expected to regulate and facilitate the growth of the industry.

agency_name: Kenya Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis Eradication Council (KENTTEC)
agency_description: Kenya Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis Eradication Council (KENTTEC) is a state Corporation mandated to coordinate all Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis eradication activities in Kenya. The Council was gazetted by Government of Kenya through a gazette legal notice no. 77 of July 2012 as a successor to the Pan-African Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis Eradication Campaign.

Our mandate is to exercise general supervision and control over the training, business, practice and employment of veterinary surgeons and veterinary paraprofessionals in Kenya and advise the government in relation to all aspects thereof.
Producing safe, Quality and Affordable Veterinary Vaccines for Improvement of the Livestock Industry.

The Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD) is an agency tasked with regulating the manufacture, importation, exportation, registration, distribution, prescription and dispensing of veterinary medicines and other animal health products in Kenya. VMD was established pursuant to CAP 366 (article 39) of the laws of Kenya

agency_name: Institute Of Certified Public Secretaries Of Kenya (ICPSK)
agency_description: The Institute of Certified Secretaries of Kenya (ICS) is the professional organization for Certified Secretaries.
The Registrar of Cooperative Societies of Kenya oversees the registration and regulation of cooperative societies in the country.
Access SASRA's online services for Licensed and Authorized SACCOs

Kenya Industrial Estates (KIE) is a government parastatal and development finance institution under the Ministry of Co-operatives and MSME Development. It supports the growth of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) across Kenya through industrial clustering, value addition, and entrepreneurship development. KIE provides affordable medium and long-term financing, business advisory services, and SME incubation programs in priority sectors like agro-processing, textiles, and metal fabrication. With 37 branches and SME Parks nationwide, KIE also facilitates technology transfer, market access, and rural industrialization, playing a critical role in Kenya’s Vision 2030 and the Big Four Agenda.

To provide Business and Management Development Services to MSMEs and other Interest Groups through: Training, Research, Consultancy, Counseling, Extension Services and Business Information for improved performance
The Authority plans to spark industrial revolution by undertaking policy reforms and implementing targeted programmes and activities in the MSE sector
Pioneering in financial inclusion by promoting equal and fair access to financial services for the underserved.

Kenya Shipyards Limited (KSL) was incorporated on 29 September 2020 with a mandate to lead and catalyse the introduction of shipbuilding industry in Eastern Africa with a focus on meeting the local demand from Kenya Navy, Ministries Departments and Agencies (MDAs) with maritime assets and other public and private domestic and regional clients.

The Agency is a State Corporation under the Ministry of Defence mandated to promote, coordinate and regulate space-related activities to enhance utilization of space technology for national socio economic development.

NDU-K was established under Section 24 of the Universities Education Act, 2012 on 27 May 2021. The University offers specialized certificates, diplomas and degrees in areas related to Defence and security, as well as other dimensions of security. The University is based at Lanet, Nakuru County

Ulinzi Health Services Fund ( UHSF) is a government-established fund that finances the provision, modernization and sustainable operation of medical and health services at Kenya Defence Forces Level IV, V and VI hospital facilities, using income from services, appropriations, grants and other lawful sources. It supports improved quality care, research, training and equipment procurement while expanding access to civilians and backing national health goals.

agency_name: Kenya Development Response to Displacement Impacts Project (KDRDIP)
agency_description: Kenya Development Response to Displacement Impacts Project (KDRDIP) is a National Government initiative, supported by the World Bank to improve the lives of the refugee-hosting communities in the north of the country. It is a Community Driven Development (CDD) where communities identify, plan, implement, monitor and sustain their development projects
To provide leadership and coordination of Kenya's effort in the management of drought risks and enhancing adaptation to climate change

agency_name: Tana and Athi Rivers Development Authority
agency_description: The Tana and Athi Rivers Development Authority (TARDA) is a State Corporation established under the Tana and Athi Rivers Development Act, CAP 443 of 1974. Its core mandate is to plan, coordinate, and implement integrated programs and projects that optimize the use of land and water resources within the Tana and Athi river basins, with the ultimate goal of empowering local communities and fostering regional development

agency_name: The State Department for East African Community
agency_description: The State Department for East African Community is charged with the responsibility of coordinating and implementing policies, strategies and programmes aimed at deepening regional integration. It formulates policy on East African Community, coordinates Government and private sector participation in the EAC Affairs, coordinates the implementation of the EAC regional programmes, coordinates the implementation of EAC Treaty and promotes and fast tracks EAC integration process.

agency_name: Centre for Mathematics, Science, and Technology Education in Africa (CEMASTEA
agency_description: The Centre’s core mandate is capacity development in Pedagogical Content Knowledge (PCK) and ICT integration in STEM education for teachers in Basic education. Other programmes include STEM & Robotics Boot Camps and Outreaches, Science and Innovation fairs, Education for Sustainable Development (ESD), Climate Change, Inclusive and Gender Responsive trainings. The Centre also promotes partnerships and linkages in STEM Education.
The Jomo Kenyatta Foundation is a parastatal under the Ministry of Education, with a mandate of awarding scholarships to bright but needy students to secondary school.
Ensuring a fair, safe, and inclusive environment for the well-being of visually impaired Kenyans.

The Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development (KICD) was established by the Government of Kenya on the 14th of January 2013 under an Act of Parliament- It also evaluates vets and approves the curricular and curriculum support materials for basic and tertiary education, as well as offering curriculum based consultancy services in basic and tertiary education and training.

Kenya Institute of Special Education (KISE) is a semi-autonomous government agency of the Ministry of Education, Kenya. It was established through a Legal Notice No. 17 of 14th February 1986. Our goal is to ensure that every child with special needs and disability accesses quality education and achieves their full potential.

The Commission mobilizes financial, technical, and informational resources from UNESCO; promotes collaborations between national and international institutions; promotes knowledge and information sharing; facilitates national and international policy formulation in the fields of Education, Sciences, Culture, and Communication & Information among other functions.
Set and maintain examinations standards

agency_name: National Council for Nomadic Education in Kenya (NACONEK)
agency_description: National Council for Nomadic Education in Kenya (NACONEK) works to improve education access and quality in marginalized areas of Kenya. They develop policies, secure resources, coordinate efforts with other organizations, and set standards specifically suited to the needs of these communities

Bomet University College is a Constituent College of Moi University established under a Legal Notice Number 145 of 27th July 2017. It is the first public university in Bomet County, strategically placed at the heart of Bomet Town. Its establishment aligns with the government's policy to establish at least one university in every county.

To provide access, generate, preserve and share knowledge for quality, effective and ethical leadership in higher education, training, research and outreach through nurturing an intellectual culture that integrates theory with practice, innovation and entrepreneurship.
Access CUE's online services for recognition, accreditation, quality audit, licensing, and collaboration.

To provide academically stimulating, culturally diverse and quality learning environment that fosters research, innovation and technology development towards producing relevant technical and managerial human resource and leaders to contribute to attainment of national development goals.

agency_name: Jaramogi Oginga Odinga University of Science and Technology
agency_description: To provide quality University education that nurtures creativity and innovation through integrated training, research and community outreach for sustainable development.

agency_name: Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology
agency_description: To offer accessible quality training, research, innovation and entrepreneurship in order to produce leaders in the fields of Agriculture, Engineering, Technology, Enterprise Development, Built Environment, Health Sciences, Social Sciences and other Applied Sciences to suit the needs of a dynamic world.
To provide quality education and training, research and innovation to meet the needs of a dynamic Society

Karatina University is a public chartered institution of higher learning as provided for in the Universities Act of 2012, domiciled in Kenya - Nyeri County. It is located 140km North of Nairobi (0039’S37014’E) and 15km from Karatina town, off the Nairobi-Nyeri highway, in an area rich in agricultural soils and endowed with vast natural resources. The mandate of Karatina University is to conserve, create and disseminate knowledge through training, research, innovation and community outreach.

agency_name: Kenya Universities and Colleges Placement Service
agency_description: he Kenya Universities and Colleges Central Placement Service (KUCCPS) is a StateCorporation that provides career guidance and selects students for admission to universities,national polytechnics, technical training institutes and other accredited higher learninginstitutions for Government of Kenya-sponsored programmes
Providing high quality programs that attract individuals who wish to be globally competitive

To achieve excellence in generation, transmission and enhancement of new knowledge in Science, Technology and Innovation through quality Teaching, Research, Training, Scholarship, Consultancy and Outreach Programmes.

To train and develop human resources equipped with innovative skills to inspire enterprise in the disciplines of engineering, science, health and technology, to meet the demands of a dynamic world. Our courses are geared towards producing skilled manpower to create and occupy opportunities in the new dynamic world while addressing areas outlined by the Vision 2030 and beyond.

A world-class University in the advancement of academic excellence, research and social welfare aiming to train human resource that meets the development needs of the country and international labour market, sustaining the production of quality and relevant research, disseminate knowledge, skills, values and competencies for the advancement of humanity.

Koitaleel Samoei University College (KSUC) was established in 2015 under the mentorship of the University of Nairobi. KSUC is therefore a creation of section 8 of the University of Nairobi Charter and section 42 of the Universities Act No. 42 of 2012. KSUC Main Campus is in Nandi Hills and Mosoriot Campus where it was formally Mosoriot Teachers Training College

Maasai Mara University is dedicated to delivering top-tier education, grounded in cutting-edge research and enhanced by global partnerships with industries and academic institutions. The university's areas of expertise encompass Business, Computing, ICT, Education, Psychology, Tourism, Environmental Sciences, and Health Sciences and Research. At the heart of our mission is the pursuit of knowledge and personal transformation. The university is a vibrant community of learners, and our aim is to provide insight into what distinguishes our institution: our unwavering commitment to academic excellence

Machakos University is a vibrant premier higher education institution whose core mandate is to teach, train, conduct research, innovate, offer community service, generate new knowledge and facilitate technology transfer.

Mama Ngina University College is a constituent college of Kenyatta University located in Gatundu, Kiambu County. The university college offers a wide range of high-quality market-driven academic programmes with a major focus on Digital Technology and Primary Health Care.
To discover, harness, apply, disseminate and preserve knowledge for good of humanity

agency_name: Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology
agency_description: To provide excellent university education, training and research through integrating science, technology and innovation into quality programmes to suit the needs of a dynamic world.
Mandate: A world-class University of excellence in Science and Technology aiming to provide quality University education, training and research in Science, Technology and innovation.
Experience hassle-free access to Moi University's online services from anywhere.
To advance knowledge and technological transfer through teaching, training, learning, research, and innovation for sustainable development.

agency_name: National Commission for Science Technology and Innovation
agency_description: The National Commission for Science, Technology and Innovation (NACOSTI) is a state corporation established under the Science, Technology and Innovation Act, 2013 (Revised 2014). The mandate of the Commission is to regulate and assure quality in the science, technology and innovation sector and advise the Government in matters related thereto

The National Research Fund (NRF) is a Semi-Autonomous Government Agency established under the Science Technology and Innovation (ST&I) Act No. 28, Section 32 of 2013. Its mandate is to mobilize, allocate, and manage financial resources to facilitate an effective national innovation system that would create required knowledge and innovations in all fields of Science and Technology for the growing economy.

To provide affordable, flexible, quality learning experiences which enable individual acquisition of knowledge, skills and values in learners chosen fields of study; nurturing them into innovative researchers, leaders, entrepreneurs and global citizens

To create a strong knowledge base through teaching, research and innovation, and to disseminate this knowledge to produce all rounded graduates with problem solving skills for positive societal transformation.
To produce competent human capital through quality education, training, research & innovation, and empower communities through outreach for socio-economic transformation.

The Mandate of Tom Mboya University is to teach, train, carry out research and disseminate knowledge for the greatest benefit and wellbeing of society and by law provide for all the functions and objects of a university that are generally provided under the Universities Act 2012.
Welcome to the Cradle of Knowledge, a globally esteemed university in teaching, research and outreach

Our key mandate is to appoint funds to universities, Mobilize and receive funds for Universities from the government, donors and other sources, and advise the cabinet secretary on university education and related issues.
providing quality education, training, research and consultancy in Science, Agriculture, and Technology to meet the needs and aspirations of a dynamic society

UoN is committed to quality education through teaching, research and creative works. We are a research intensive university with a reputation for excellence and a strong and vibrant research culture.

Kenya National Qualifications Authority accepts online applications of academic qualifications for alignment into the Kenya National Qualifications Framework(KNQF) according to the level descriptors and validation from both Kenyans and Foreigners through this platform

Kenya School of TVET (KSTVET) formerly Kenya Technical Trainers College (KTTC) is a Government Institution under the Ministry of Education established with the primary objective of training Technical Trainers to teach in Technical, Vocational Education and Training (TVET) institutions, and be employed in all sectors of the economy.

agency_name: P C Kinyanjui Technical Training Institute
agency_description: To produce innovative and industrious graduates with relevant technological knowledge and skills to fit in the labour market both locally and globally.

Rift Valley Technical Training institute is a public technical training institute located in the highland city of Eldoret, Kenya. It is one of the Technical Training Institutes in Kenya. The institution offers Artisan, Craft, Diploma and Higher Diploma Courses with bias to practical industrial applications

agency_name: Technical And Vocational Education And Training Authority
agency_description: To develop a TVET system that meets national needs and aspirations

The Maasai National Polytechnic is a government public Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) institution under the Ministry of Education. It is registered to offer an array of Competency Based Education and Training (CBET) programs which are key in equipping the youth with relevant skills aligned with the industry requirements and focal to our economy.
The Nairobi National Polytechnic (TNNP) is a public tertiary Polytechnic under the Ministry of Education, State Department for Vocational and Technical Training.
Take advantage of our convenient online services for Electricity Applications, Accessing Bill Statements, Registering Complaints, Making Payments and many more.

agency_name: Rural Electrification And Renewable Energy Corporation(REREC)
agency_description: To provide sustainable energy solutions for all through rural electrification and renewable energy for social economic transformation.

The State Department of Energy aims to develop and implement policies that create an enabling environment for efficient operation and growth of Kenya’s energy sector. The Ministry sets strategic directions to facilitate the growth of the sector while providing long term vision for all sector players.
Access EPRA’s online services for application and renewal of licenses and permits in the energy sector.
Providing weather and climate Information services for sustainable development
We are a state corporation under the Ministry of Environment, Climate Change and Forestry mandated to mobilize, avail and manage resources for sustainable Environmental management in Kenya.

The National Environmental Complaints Committee (NECC) is established under Sections 31 to 36 of the Environmental Management and Co-ordination Act of 1999. Its mandate is to investigate allegations or complaints regarding the condition of the environment in Kenya, or on its own motion, suspected cases of environmental degradation. It is also mandated to undertake public interest litigation on behalf of the citizens in environmental matters.
Apply for Permits and Licenses issued by National Environment Management Authority.
The Service is mandated to conserve, develop and sustainably manage forests and allied resources for environmental stability and the social-economic development of the people of Kenya.

KEFRI conducts research in forestry and allied natural resources, Disseminate research findings to stakeholders, Build capacity of stakeholders and Establish partnerships and cooperate with other research organizations and institutions of higher learning in joint research and training.
To champion the welfare, rights and interests of the Kenyans in the diaspora enabling them to make competitive contributions towards national development.

The Fourth Schedule of the Constitution of Kenya identifies Foreign Affairs and Foreign Policy as a function of the National Government. The broad mandate of the Ministry for Foreign and Diaspora Affairs is to manage Kenya’s Foreign Policy. Currently, the Ministry oversees 65 Diplomatic Missions Abroad, 2 Missions in Nairobi and 31 Honorary Consuls spread across the globe.

BOMAS of Kenya was started by the Government of Kenya in 1971 as wholly owned subsidiary of the Tourism Finance Corporation (TFC) the Company was established to Preserve, Maintain and Promote the Rich Diverse cultural values of various ethnic groups of Kenya and to act as a tourist attraction centre thus Bomas of Kenya is expected to preserve the authenticity of the Kenya’s Cultural values and to portray them in the pure form

The Kenya Cultural Centre (KCC) is a State Corporation established through an Act of Parliament Cap 218 under the Ministry of Youth Affairs, the Arts and Sports. We are dedicated to the preservation of Kenya's rich cultural heritage and history, ensuring their transmission to generations to come. This noble endeavour is realized through a Centre that nurtures artistic expression, catering to both performing and visual artists.

agency_name: Kenya National Archives and Documentation Service
agency_description: Preserving valuable public records as part of the documentary heritage of the Republic of Kenya.
Preserving the national documentary heritage and enabling access to informationand knowledge

National Museums of Kenya (NMK) is a state corporation established by an Act of Parliament, the Museums and Heritage Act 2006. NMK is a multi-disciplinary institution whose role is to collect, preserve, study, document and present Kenya’s past and present cultural and natural heritage
Trasforming traditional art into tradeable commodities for significant economic and social impact
To uphold the dignity and empowerment of girls and women in Kenya through coordination of initiatives, awareness creation and advocacy against FGM.

To promote and ensure gender equality, principles of equality and non-discrimination for all personsin Kenya as provided for in the Constitution of Kenya 2010 with a focus on the following special interest groups (SIGs): Women, persons with disability, Children, youth,older members of the society, minority and marginalised groups

agency_name: The National Government Affirmative Action Fund
agency_description: To facilitate social-economic empowerment of affirmative action groups through financial and financial and social support for inclusive and sustainable development.

agency_name: Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Teaching & Referral Hospital (JOOTRH)
agency_description: Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Teaching & Referral Hospital (JOOTRH) is a major public health facility in Kisumu, Kenya, serving as a teaching hospital and referral center for the western region. It offers specialized medical services, advanced diagnostics, and training for healthcare professionals.

The mandate of the Kenya BioVax Institute (KBI) is to manufacture human vaccines and other routine and emergency vaccines to serve the people of Kenya and beyond, to manufacture other biomedical products including, among others, biosimilar anti-cancers, snake anti-venoms, insulin, medical infusions, and other biomedical products that can use the same platform as that of production of vaccines, to manufacture pharmaceutical diagnostics and health products and technologies (HPTs) including rapid diagnostic test kits, assistive devices and specialized HPTs for cancer and gene therapy, to support technology transfer and commercialization of research outputs from research institutions, colleges, and universities; and to support local pharmaceutical industries in development and production of quality and affordable products.
Explore Kemri's online services to access health research, innovation and capacity building.

The Kenya Tissue and Transplant Authority is established under Section 3 of the State Corporations Act Cap 446 vide legal Notice 142 of 2022. KTTA is mandated to coordinate, oversee and ensure access to safe blood, blood transfusion and Transplant Services in Kenya.

KNH offers quality specialized healthcare to patients from the Great Lakes Region, Southern and Central Africa. These services include open heart surgery, neurosurgery, orthopedics surgery, reconstructive surgery, burns management, critical care services, new born services, ophthalmology (cornea transplant), liver resections, oncology, palliative care and renal services (including kidney transplantation), among others

agency_name: Mathari National Teaching and Referral Hospital
agency_description: Mathari National Teaching and Referral Hospital (MNTRH) is Kenya’s leading mental health care facility (level 6). With 700 inpatient beds, we offer comprehensive mental health care, outpatient services, and rehabilitation. Our specialized services include psychiatric care, forensic psychiatry, and child and adolescent mental health care. MNTRH also engages in community outreach to raise mental health awareness and education

is a Multi-Specialty National Teaching and Referral Hospital serving the Western half of Kenya (23 Counties with a population of over 25 million people, Eastern Uganda, Southern Sudan, Northern Tanzania, and Democratic Republic of Congo amongst other areas
To enhance equitable and sustainable health and wellbeing of our community, cushioning them from financial hardship.

The Social Health Authority (SHA) is a State corporation under the Government of Kenya responsible for the provision and management of public health insurance within the Republic of Kenya.The core mandate of the SHA is to provide accessible, affordable, sustainable, and quality health insurance for all Kenyan citizens and, where applicable, foreign residents.

agency_name: The National Cancer Institute of Kenya
agency_description: The National Cancer Institute of Kenya (NCI-Kenya) is a State Corporation established under the Cancer Prevention and Control Act (No. 15 of 2012). This was in recognition of the need for a more coordinated health sector response to the growing cancer burden in Kenya

CLINICAL OFFICERS COUNCIL mandate is to regulate training,registration, licensing and practice of all Clinical officers. COC worksto ensure that the Clinical Officers are trained to address Kenyans’ healthneeds and deliver high quality health services.

The counselors and Psychologists Board seeks to protect individuals and communities' mental health by promoting professional standards, supporting continuous professional growth, and offering ethical guidance leading to competency in counseling and psychological practice.

To provide oversight in the regulation of health care services; training, registration and licensing of health professionals; coordinate joint health inspections; receive and facilitate resolution of complaints and arbitrate disputes/conflicts; ensure compliance of health professionals standards and monitor execution of respective mandates and functions of health regulatory bodies.
To improve human health and biodiversity through advances in basic and preclinical biomedical research and non-human primate conservation.

agency_name: Kenya Medical Laboratory Technicians and Technologists Board
agency_description: KMLTTB strives to ensure that medical services in the country are regulated and aligned to the global emerging trends in an effort to provide the highest quality medical services to Kenyans without compromise.

agency_name: Kenya Medical Practitioners And Dentists Council
agency_description: To regulate the training, practice and licensing of medicine & dentistry and healthcare institutions that include private & mission hospitals, medical, dental centers & clinics, nursing and maternity homes and standalone funeral homes
To produce competent health professionals through training and research, and provide consultancy services

The Institute was established to consolidate and coordinate key activities in public health, including prevention, early detection of public health emergencies, and events of concern. The institute's mandate is to strengthen and promote public health issues by providing a centralized platform for managing and responding to outbreaks and emergencies at various levels, from national to community

Kenya Nuclear Regulatory Authority (KNRA) is a public entity established under Section 5 of the Nuclear Regulatory Act No. 29 of 2019, which commenced on 10th January 2020, to provide protection of persons, property and the environment against the harmful effects of ionizing and non-ionizing radiation through the establishment of a system of regulatory control.

agency_name: The National Syndemic Diseases Control Council (NSDCC)
agency_description: The Council is mandated to manage the following Syndemic diseases; HIV, sexually transmitted infections, malaria, leprosy, tuberculosis and lung disease.

The Communications Authority of Kenya (CA) is the regulatory authority for the communications sector in Kenya. the Authority is responsible for facilitating the development of the information and communications sectors including; broadcasting, cybersecurity, multimedia, telecommunications, electronic commerce, postal and courier services.
To provide leadership in transmission of objective, informative, educative and entertaining content to the public through high quality broadcasts.

The Kenya Institute of Mass Communication (KIMC) is a public media training institution under the Ministry of Information, Communications and Digital Economy. It was established in 1961 with a core mandate in media and communication training at middle level for both public and private sector. It has a strong emphasis on practical hands - on training aimed at meeting the great demand in the ever-changing technology industry
Provide information to citizens to make informed decisions.

Kenya Yearbook Editorial Board enhances government communication by disseminating credible information page by page, on projects, initiatives and developments that positively change the lives of citizens.

The Media Council of Kenya is an independent national institution established by the Media Council Act, No. 46 of 2013 to set media standards and ensure compliance with those standards as envisaged in Article 34(5) of the Constitution.

agency_name: Office Of The Data Protection Commissioner
agency_description: Protect personal data in Kenya through compliance, enforcement, public awareness and institutional capacity development
To provide end to end, innovative, reliable, Mail, Courier, Logistics, e- Commerce and Payment Services that delight our customers and create value to our stakeholders.

Konza Technopolis is a flagship project under Kenya’s Vision 2030 that aims to transform the country into a newly industrializing middle-income country providing a high quality of life to all its citizens in a clean and secure environment.

agency_name: The Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Authority
agency_description: Our broad mandate entails enforcing ICT standards in Government and enhancing the supervision of its electronic communication. We also promote ICT literacy, capacity, innovation, and enterprise.

Access the Directorate of Criminal Investigations' online platform for police clearance certificate services and more.
Utilize DIS's online services for efficient ePassport, temporary permit, and eVisa applications.

The Department of National Registration Bureau was established in 1978 to implement the Registration of Persons Act, Cap 107, laws of Kenya. The Act provides for mandatory identification, registration and issuance of identity cards to all persons who are citizens of Kenya and who have attained the age of eighteen years or over.
Gain convenient access to our online betting and gambling regulatory services, ensuring fairness and transparency.
Resposible for regulating, licensing and controlling the manufacture, importation, exportation, transportation, sale, repair, storage, possession and use of firearms.

To provide Forensic Science and Analytical Laboratory services to Government Institutions, private sector and the public for the purpose of safeguarding human health, environment and administration of justice.
To conduct impartial and independent investigations, inspections, audits and monitoring of the National Police Service to prevent impunity and enhance professionalism in the interest of the public

agency_name: Kenya School of Adventure and Leadership
agency_description: Enhancing leadership, team building skills, personal development and environment awareness through experiential training.

agency_name: National Authority For The Campaign Against Alcohol And Drug Abuse (NACADA)
agency_description: Access NACADA online services on the campaign against alcohol and drug abuse

The National Cohesion and Integration Commission complaints management system is a platform meant to streamline the reporting and handling of hate speech, ethnic contempt, ethnic discrimination in employment, and other related offenses.

The National Crime Research Centre (NCRC) is a State Corporationunder The Ministry of Interior and National Administration establishedby an Act of Parliament, the National Crime Research Act 1997 CAP 62Laws of Kenya. The Centre is mandated to carry out research into thecauses of crime, its prevention and to disseminate the research findingsand recommendations to Government Agencies concerned with theadministration of criminal justice, NCRC’s stakeholders and the public

The Non-Governmental Organizations Co-ordination Board is a State Corporation established by the Non-Governmental Organizations Co-ordination Act (Cap 19) of 1990. The Board has the responsibility of regulating and enabling the NGO sector in Kenya. The NGOs Co-ordination Board started its operations in 1992 and is currently under the Ministry of Interior and Co-ordination of National Government.

The PSRA is a State Corporation whose mandate is to provide for a framework of regulation of the Private security Services industry and to provide a forum of cooperation between the Private Security Service industry and State Security Agencies.

The Kenya Bureau of Standards (KEBS) has remained the premier government agency for the provision of Standards, Metrology and Conformity Assessment (SMCA) services since its inception in 1974. Over that period its main activities have grown from the development of standards and quality control for a limited number of locally made products in the 1970s to the provision of more comprehensive Standards development, Metrology, Conformity Assessment, Training and Certification services. With the re-establishment of the East African Community (EAC) and Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA), KEBS activities now include participation in the development and implementation of SMCA activities at the regional level where it participates in the harmonization of standards, measurements and conformity assessment regimes for regional integration. KEBS operates the National Enquiry Point in support of the WTO Agreement on Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT).

The Institute is charged with administration of Industrial Property Rights; Provision of Technological Information to the public; Promoting Inventiveness in Kenya and Provision of Training on Industrial Property.

agency_name: Kenya Industrial Research and Development Institute (KIRDI)
agency_description: KIRDI is a public research institution under the Ministry of Investments, Trade and Industry. The mandate of the Institute is to undertake research, development and innovation in industrial and allied technologies and to disseminate the research findings to support industrial development.

Numerical Machining Complex (NMC) is a public company owned by Kenya Railways (49%) and Kenya Shipyard Limited (51%). It specializes in mechanical engineering, offering modern facilities and skilled staff for machinery design, manufacturing, and various processes such as machining, fabrication, foundry works, heat treatment, and metallurgical analysis.

Rivatex is committed to providing quality products and services to achieve sustained, profitable growth by offering services and products which consistently satisfy the needs and expectations of its customers.

The Export Processing Zones Authority (EPZA) is a State Corporation under the Ministry of Investments, Trade & Industry (MITI), established in 1990 by the EPZ Act CAP 517, Laws of KenyaDevelopment of all aspects of the Export Processing Zones (EPZ) with particular emphasis on the provision of advice on the removal of impediments to, and creation of incentives for, export-oriented production in areas designated as export processing zones;

KDC is mandated to play a catalytic role in Kenya’s socio-economic development by providing long-term financing and other financial, investment and business advisory services. Therefore, KDC plays an important role in addressing critical gaps for long-term funding that cannot be met by commercial banks in target sectors in Kenya and elsewhere.

Kenya Investment Authority (KenInvest) is a statutory body established in 2004 and currently operating through an Act of Parliament (Investment Promotion Act No. 6 of 2004) with the main objective of promoting investments in Kenya. It is responsible for facilitating the implementation of new investment projects, providing After Care services for new and existing investments, as well as organizing investment promotion activities both locally and internationally

SEZA is responsible for attracting, facilitating and retaining domestic and foreign direct investments in Special Economic Zones (SEZs). The Authority serves as the regulator of both public and private SEZs in Kenya and exists to create an enabling environment for investors through the development of integrated infrastructure facilities, as well as the creation of incentives that eliminate the barriers to doing business in Eastern Africa’s most vibrant economic hub

agency_name: The Kenya Export Promotion and Branding Agency
agency_description: The Kenya Export Promotion and Branding Agency is a State Corporation established under the State Corporations Act Cap 446 through Legal Notice No.110 of August 9th, 2019 after the merger of the Export Promotion Council and Brand Kenya Board. The Agency's mandate is to implement export promotion and nation branding initiatives and policies to promote Kenya’s export of goods and services.

The Kenya National Trading Corporation Ltd is a State Corporation in the Ministry of Industry, Trade & Investment, mandated to act as a procurement agent for the government and participate in the promotion of wholesale and retail trade in order to strengthen the supply chain of essential products within the country.

agency_name: Directorate of Occupational Safety and Health Services
agency_description: To promote a safe and healthy workplace by implementing effective systems for the prevention of Occupational diseases, ill health, accidents, and property damage to reduce the cost of production and improve productivity in all sectors of our economic activities.

The National Employment Authority (NEA) provides for a comprehensive institutional framework for employment management; enhancement of employment promotion interventions; and increasing access to employment by the youth, minorities and marginalized groups
The National Industrial Training Authority (NITA) is a state corporation established under the Industrial Training (Amendment) Act of 2011.

The National Social Security Fund is a State Corporation that offers social protection to all workers in Kenya. The Fund provides social security protection to workers in the formal and informal sectors.

agency_name: National Council for Persons with Disabilities(NCPWD)
agency_description: To promote and protect equalization of opportunities and realization of human rights for PWDs to live descent livelihoods.

The mandate of the agency is coordinate community empowerment and promote the rights and welfare of vulnerable persons, as a fundamental part of national development through provision of child and social protection services.
The National Housing Development Fund is a government initiative aimed at facilitating affordable housing for Kenyan citizens.
Dedicated platform for Registration of Contractors, Projects and Skilled Workers, Among Other Services

The State Department for Public Works is charged with the responsibility of Planning, Environment and Infrastructure Development. The State Department achieves and maintains excellence in the construction and maintenance of Public buildings and other public works.
Access permits and licenses via the Kenya Maritime Authority's new online service portal.
To provide competitive shipping and logistics services and safeguard national aspirations in facilitating global trade
The mandate of the Kenya Fisheries Service as per the Fisheries Management and Development Act, No. 35 of 2016 is to Conserve, Manage and Develop Kenya’s Fisheries and Aquaculture resources.

The Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation’s mandate is to exploit fishery resources in the Kenya fishery waters and high seas by promoting establishment and efficiency of businesses engaged in the fishing and fishing related activities.

agency_name: Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute
agency_description: KMFRI's mandate is to undertake research in "marine and freshwater fisheries, aquaculture, environmental and ecological studies, and marine research including chemical and physical oceanography", in order to provide scientific data and information for sustainable development of the Blue Economy.

The Huduma Kenya Service Delivery Programme has the mandate to transform Public Service Delivery in order to ensure access to efficient, effective and citizen-centric services through One-Stop-Shop platforms.

agency_name: Human Resource Management Professionals Examinations Board
agency_description: Human Resource Management Professionals Examinations Board (HRMPEB) is a state corporation established by section 16 of the Human Resource Management Professionals Act, no. 52, 2012 as an examinations body, mandated to develop and review curricula, examine and certify Human Resource Professionals
To contribute to the transformation of public services by inculating national values and developing core skills and competencies for quality service delivery

Its mandate is to achieve social inclusion by recruiting youth and people with disability, vulnerable and marginalized youth, female recruits, undertake socio-economic tasks of national importance, equips the youth with skills that can help them secure employment or be self-employed and increase job and training opportunities while enhancing revenue generation for the sustainability of the Service.
To Reform and Transform the Public Service for Efficient and Effective Service Delivery

agency_name: The Institute of Human Resource Management (IHRM)
agency_description: The Institute of Human Resource Management (IHRM) is a Statutory Professional Body established under the Human Resource Management Professionals (HRMP) Act, No. 52 of 2012. Its mandate is to regulate the HR profession in Kenya, and enhance competencies and capabilities while supporting innovative and transformative HR practices and standards.
Access EBKs online services for application and renewal of engineering licenses

The Kenya Engineering Technology Registration Board (KETRB) is a state corporation established under section 3(1) of the Engineering Technology Act, No.23 of 2016. The Act mandates the Board to regulate the practice and set standards for engineering technologists and technicians including craft-persons and artisans.

The Kenya National Highways Authority (KeNHA) is a statutory body established under the Kenya Roads Act of 2007 and inaugurated in September 2008.KeNHA is responsible for the development, rehabilitation, management and maintenance of all National Trunk Roads comprising of Class S, A, and B roads.

KeRRA is a State Corporation within the State Department of Infrastructure under the Ministry of Transport, Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development and established through the Kenya Roads Act, 2007.
Managing, Developing, Rehabilitating and Maintaining the National Urban Trunk Roads

agency_name: The Kenya Institute Of Highways and Building Technology
agency_description: The Kenya Institute of Highways and Building Technology (KIHBT), is the training division of the Ministry Of Roads and Transport. It offers Capacity Building Courses in the Roads Sector, as well as Certificate, Diploma and Higher Diploma Courses
To provide consistent and delightful travel experience
To plan, develop, manage, regulate and operate a safe, economically sustainable and efficient civilaviation system in Kenya, in accordance with the provisions of the Civil Aviation Act, 2013
​​The Kenya Ports Authority’s mandate is to maintain, operate, improve and regulate all sea and inland waterway ports in Kenya.
The core mandates of the corporation are to provide efficient and effective rail and inland waterways transport.

The Nairobi Metropolitan Area Transport Authority (NaMATA) is mandated to oversee the establishment of an integrated, efficient, effective and sustainable public transport system within the Nairobi Metropolitan Area (NMA).
Dedicated platform for Application and Renewal of Driving Licence, Driving School Management and PSV related services
To provide education and Training for Transport and Logistics Sector
Develop, implement and co-ordinate a National Tourism marketing strategy
To be a globally recognized and transformative premier tourism and hospitality training center.

The Kenyatta International Convention Centre (KICC) is a State Corporation established under the Tourism Act 2011 whose objective and purpose is to promote the business of Meetings, Incentive Travel, Conferences and Exhibitions also known as MICE.
Tourism Fund established to mobilize resources for Kenya's tourism industry.
An agency in the State Department For Tourism And Wildlife in the Ministry Of Tourism, Wildlife And Heritage.
Access TRA's online services for regulated and quality tourism sector development.

The object and purpose of TRI are stated in Tourism Act No. 28 of 2011. The Act states that; TRI will undertake and co-ordinate tourism research and analysis in accordance with its provisions. This will ensure that the research and knowledge gaps that exist in the sector are adequately addressed in line with the mandate of the Institute.

agency_name: Kenya Wildlife Research and Training Institute
agency_description: To conduct and coordinate wildlife research and training through innovative approaches to enable the provision of accurate data and information to stakeholders for decision-making.
Explore. Experience. Conserve.Kenya Parks
Provide and coordinate Sustainable Development and Management of irrigation services in Kenya

agency_name: National Water Harvesting and Storage Authority
agency_description: The NWHSA’s aim is to ensure that Kenya is self-sufficient and secure in terms of water and food security through development of water infrastructure for storage, irrigation and flood control

The State Department for Irrigation was established through Executive Order No. 1 of 2023 on Organization of the Government of the Republic of Kenya. The overall mandate of the state department for irrigation is to undertake irrigation development, water harvesting and storage for irrigation and land reclamation

Athi Water Works Development Agency (AWWDA) is one of the nine (9) Water Works Development Agencies (WWDA) established under the Ministry of Water, Sanitation & Irrigation. It was established under the Water Act 2016 vide Legal Notice No. 28 of 26th April 2019. The Agency is responsible for the development, maintenance and management of water and sewerage infrastructure in the counties of Nairobi, Kiambu and Muranga Counties covering 5,800.4Km2 with a total population of 9,320,287 people.

KEWI, as established by the KEWI Act 2001 is mandated to offer training, administer examinations, and offer research and consultancy services in the wider water sector. The Act also mandates the institute to provide a forum for effective collaboration between the public and private sectors and other interested parties to develop the water and sanitation sectors.

Ministry of Water, Sanitation and Irrigation was established in the year 2023 through an Executive Order No. 1 of March, 2023. The mandate of the ministry is to promote and support integrated water resource management in Kenya.

agency_name: North Rift Valley Water Works Development Agency
agency_description: The Mandate of NRVWWDA is to undertake the development, maintenance and management of national public water works within its area of jurisdiction as provided in the Water Act 2016. NRVWWDA operations are also guided by various other legislations among them; Constitution of Kenya 2010, State Corporations Act 2012, Environmental Management and Coordination Act 1999, among others. NRVWWDA’s region covers the Counties of Uasin Gishu, West Pokot, Turkana and Elgeyo Marakwet.

Tanathi Water Works Development Agency (TAWWDA) is a State Corporation within the Ministry of Water, Sanitation and Irrigation. The Agency develops water and sewerage infrastructure on behalf of national government in its area of jurisdiction

Water Resources Authority (WRA) regulates water abstractions for different uses while ensuring equitable sharing. The process involves submitting an application, giving authorization to construct abstraction works, followed by the issuance of a water permit.

Water Sector Trust Fund (WaterFund) provides conditional and unconditional grants to Counties and assists in financing the development of and management of water and sanitation services in the marginalized and underserved areas. Its mandate includes research activities in the area of water resource management and water services, sewerage and sanitation
To provide a regulatory environment that facilitates efficiency effectiveness and equity in the provision of water services in line with the human right to water and sanitation.
Undertake development, maintenance and management of the public water works
To lead a coordinated national anti-doping education and awareness campaign, testing and promotion of integrity for doping-free sport
Access KFCB's online services to regulate film and broadcast content distribution.

The Kenya National Innovation Agency (KeNIA) is a State Corporation established under the Science, Technology and Innovation (STI) Act, No. 28 of 2013 under the Ministry of Education. The core mandate of the Agency is to develop and manage the National Innovation System. The Agency is therefore responsible for co-ordination, promotion and regulation of the National Innovation System.

Sports Kenya is a corporate body under the Ministry of Youth Affairs, Sports and the Arts established by the Sports Act 2013 with the mandate of harnessing sports development, encouraging and promoting drug free sports and recreation, providing for establishment of sports institutions facilities, administration and management of sports in the country and for connected purposes.

agency_name: The State Department for Youth Affairs and Creative Economy
agency_description: The State Department for Youth Affairs and Creative Economy is mandated to provide leadership, coordination, and an enabling environment for the development of youth and creatives empowerment programmes. This programmes include Innovation, Talent and creative industry development, Youth Social development, Entrepreneurship and Skills development as well as policy, research and mainstreaming.
Committed to developing an enabling environment for filmmakers and film industry facilitation

The President’s Award –Kenya (PA-K) is an exciting self-development programme available to all young people countrywide equipping them with positive life skills to make a difference for themselves, their communities, country, and the world.

The legislative authority of the Republic is derived from the people. Parliament may consider and pass amendments to the Constitution, Parliament shall protect this Constitution and promote the democratic governance of the Republic.

The role of the Senate includes the exercise of the legislative authority ofthe Republic, manifest of the diversity of the nation, representation of the will of thepeople, and exercise their sovereignty, consideration, and passing ofamendments to this Constitution, alteration of county boundaries, and protectionof the Constitution and promotion of the democratic governance of theRepublic.
Exprience the convinience and accessibility of Kenya's judiciary services online for efficient legal process.

agency_name: Kenya Institute For Public Policy Research And Analysis (KIPPRA)
agency_description: To provide quality public policy advice to the Government of Kenya by conducting objective research and analysis and through capacity building in order to contribute to the achievement of national development goals.

To provide strategic leadership and coordination in the implementation of the Vision as the country's blueprint and strategy towards making Kenya a newly industrializing upper middle-income, globally competitive, and prosperous country providing high quality of life for all its citizens in a clean and secure environment by the year 2030.
Capital Markets Authority is a regulator of Capital and Commodity Markets in Kenya.
To provide, manage and promote quality statistical services through utilization of best practices for evidence-based decision making

Competitive markets increase the prosperity and welfare of Kenyan consumers. Our role is to protect, strengthen and supplement the way competition works in Kenya markets and industries to improve the efficiency of the economy and to increase the welfare of Kenyans
The mandate is to provide basic services to the marginalised areas.

agency_name: Kenya Institute Of Supplies Examination Board
agency_description: Kenya Institute of Supplies Examination Board (KISEB) is a professional examination body with the mandate to develop syllabuses, conduct examinations for professional supply chain management certification.

The Kenya Institute of Supplies Management is a body corporate established under Section 3 of the “Supplies Practitioners Management Act, 2007”. The mandate of KISM is to, amongst others, make provision for the training, registration, and licensing of supplies practitioners; to regulate their practice and for connected purposes.

The Kenya National Entrepreneurs Savings Trust (KNEST) is a unique National Informal Sector Scheme designedto meet the unique diverse needs of the marginalized informal Sector workers who have traditionally been excluded from the existing formal pensions and savings arrangements
Kenya Trade Network Agency provides access to imports and exports clearance through the National Electronic Single Window System

LAPFUND is a Defined Contribution Scheme registered and regulated by the Retirement Benefits Act of 1997 and Subsequent Regulations. We are a State Corporation established in 1960 by an Act of Parliament Cap. 272, Laws of Kenya. We operate in accordance with the County Governments Act 2012 (section 132).

Pensions Department mandate is Administration and payment of pensions, death gratuities and other retirement benefits to eligible public officers and dependants; operationalization of public sector pension laws and advice on public pension policy.

Policyholders Compensation Fund (PCF) is a State Corporation under the National Treasury and Economic Planning that is established under Section 179 of the Insurance Act (CAP 487, Laws of Kenya) and operationalized through the Legal Notice No. 105 of 2004. The Fund was established for the primary purpose of providing compensation to claimants of an insurer that has been put under statutory management or whose license has been cancelled and for the secondary purpose of increasing the general public’s confidence in the insurance sector.
To unlock the potential of public enterprises by implementing the Privatization Programme through well-designed strategies to achieve desired national objectives
The Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (PPRA) is a Kenyan government agency responsible for regulating and overseeing public procurement and asset disposal processes.

The Public Sector Accounting Standards Board (PSASB) was established and constituted in accordance to sections 192 and 193 of the PFM Act, 2012 through a Gazette Notice No. 1199 of 28th February 2014.The purpose or mandate of the Board can be summarised as follows:Set generally accepted accounting and financial standards for the Public Sector.Prescribe and pronounce generally accepted internal auditing standards.Mainstreaming of best practices for good governance, internal controls and risk management in the Public Sector.

Platform for members of the Public Service Superannuation Scheme (PSSS) to view their retirement benefits statements. Members of the PSSS contributory pension scheme comprise of Civil Servants, Teachers employed by Teachers Service Commission and the Disciplined Services Personnel (National Police Service, Kenya Prisons Service and National Youth Service)
Retirement Benefits Authority (RBA) is a regulatory body under the National Treasury, established under Retirement Benefits Act.

agency_name: The Kenya Accountants And Secretaries National Examinations Board
agency_description: Transforming business professionals through Examinations, Certification, Accreditation, Research, Innovation and Consultancy
Our primary mandate is to receive unclaimed financial assets from the holders of such assets, safeguard and re-unite the assets with their rightful owners
The Authority's mandate is to regulate, supervise and develop the insurance industry in Kenya.
To enhance mobilisation of government revenue and to facilitate growth in economic activities and trade by ensuring compliance with tax and customs laws

The College of Arms section is under the Registrar General Department and derives its mandate from the College of Arms Act, Cap 98, Laws of Kenya. The mandate of the section is to register and grant Coat of Arms, register foreign Coat of Arms and register other armorial bearings including but not limited to flags, crests, seals, emblems, badges, uniforms, ceremonial gowns and Mace.
Utilize OAG's online services for efficient marriage registration and other legal services.
The Registrar of Societies provides diverse digital services for efficient registration processes.
Dedicated platform for Anonymously reporting proceeds of crime.
Leverage BRS's digital platform for simplified and efficient business registration procedures.

Promoting legal education and training, and the maintenance of the highest possible standards in legal education providers; and the provision of a system to guarantee the quality of legal education and legal education providers.
To facilitate law reform conducive to social, economic and political development
To provide professional legal education and training through the Advocates and Paralegal Training Programs, and promote continuing legal education for advocates in Kenya and beyond.

agency_name: National Council for Law Reporting (Kenya Law)
agency_description: The mandate of Kenya Law is to publish the judicial opinions of the superior courts of Kenya i.e. the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and the High Court. NCLR is the designated publisher of the Kenya Law Reports.

agency_name: Office of the Registrar of Political Parties
agency_description: The Office of the Registrar of Political Parties is committed to promote the realization of political rights through registration and regulation of political parties in Kenya.You can now register a political party, verify your political party membership status, join a political party of choice and resign from a political party in a simple and secure way online.
